  • Method Details

    • convertTime

      public static ZonedDateTime convertTime(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a UTC timestamp from the database to the system's time zone. IntelliJ suggested the return line.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - The UTC timestamp.
      Returns:
      The timestamp converted to the system's time zone.

    • timeCollection

      public static ZonedDateTime timeCollection(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> apptHour, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> apptMinute, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker apptDate)
      Constructs a ZonedDateTime in UTC from the hour, minute, and date, which can be saved to the database. I created combo boxes to select each element. This also joins them to prepare for saving.
      Parameters:
      apptHour - The hour of the appointment.
      apptMinute - The minute of the appointment.
      apptDate - The date of the appointment.
      Returns:
      The constructed ZonedDateTime in UTC.

    • currentZoned

      public static ZonedDateTime currentZoned()
      Retrieves the current time in UTC. Zone ID of the system, then same instance of that time in the UTC zone.
      Returns:
      The current ZonedDateTime in UTC.

    • businessHours

      public static boolean businessHours(ZonedDateTime start, ZonedDateTime end)
      Checks if the start and end times are inside business hours (8:00 to 22:00) in Eastern Time.
      Parameters:
      start - The start time of the appointment.
      end - The end time of the appointment.
      Returns:
      Boolean. True if the appointment is within business hours, false if not.
